abstract.para: This document is intended for software developers interested in developing applications using the Rackspace Cloud Databases Application Program Interface (API).

chapter.title: Document Change History
chapter.para: This version of the Release Notes replaces and obsoletes all previous versions. The most recent changes are described in the table below:

listitem.para: ERROR instances can now be deleted.
Password check bug was fixed for ignore users (root, os_admin).
Update to the client to list mgmt instances (from the last release).
Sneaky is no longer staying in the build forever.
Better support to handle errors when calling nova to create servers
Usage initial deployment
Mgmt fixing default dict bugs
Mgmt xml serialization for accounts
Mgmt reboot instances
Mgmt instance bugfix when nova instance doesnt exist
Mgmt list accounts non deleted instances

chapter.title: v1.0.3, July 2, 2012
chapter.para: As expected during Early Access, our API contract is not yet complete. Please be advised that we are introducing contract breaking changes, as described below, in this release. After this update, our contract will be locked and available for stable integrations. Any future changes to the contract will result in a change to the API version.

itemizedlist.title: Contract breaking changes for this release are as follows:

listitem.para: The GET /instances call now returns flavor, volume size, status and no longer returns hostname or created/updated status.
The GET /flavors call now returns all flavor detail information.

para.emphasis: When using JSON to Create Database Instance via API request, the volume size parameter should always be an unquoted integer.

listitem.para: The API JSON response for this call will now return an unquoted integer and will no longer return a string for the volume size parameter.

para.emphasis: Pagination has been added to all list operations.

listitem.para: Pagination is now supported for all list operations: instances, databases and users.

para.emphasis: Root-enabled status must be retrieved through the List Root-Enabled Status (GET /instances/{instanceId}/root) operation.

listitem.para: Root details will not be returned in the GET /instances/{instanceId} operation.

chapter.para: These changes may require you to modify your existing code integration with the Cloud Databases API in order to access functionality without issue. Please refer to the updated documentation for this release for further details and examples.

chapter.title: v1.0.1, April 16, 2012
chapter.para: We are pleased to announce the availability of Rackspace Cloud Databases (Early Access Program [EAP]) to all US and UK Cloud customers. These release notes cover the EAP release of Rackspace Cloud Databases.

listitem.para: Provision MySQL database instances of varying flavor (RAM) sizes without the need to maintain and/or update MySQL. Optionally create users and databases during instance creation for quick deployment.

Critical loads with high I/O demands are performance-optimized and protected with local RAID 10 and network RAID 10. Additionally, network RAID provides synchronous replication of volumes with automatic failover and load balancing across available storage clusters.
Increase storage allocation seamlessly without downtime as your dataset size increases.
Increase or decrease flavor (RAM) size as database input/output (I/O) demands increase.
Create, list, and delete databases on your MySQL database instance.
Control database access by adding and removing MySQL users. Optionally enable root user access for additional control.
Python-routes will not allow for dotted URLs.

There is a bug in a python library that Rackspace is using that may cause incorrect user deletions to occur if a period (.) is used in the user name. In this case, the user name is truncated to remove the portion of the name from the period to the end, leaving only the portion from the beginning up to the period.
Incorrect behavior occurs when creating a database user.

A new user can be created with a user name that already exists, but with a different password and/or database name. This causes the initially-specified user password to be changed and/or permissions to be granted to an additional database, which is incorrect behavior for a POST call.

chapter.title: Internal Information for v1.0.1 for Private Beta Participants, April 16, 2012

note.para:
We have contract-breaking changes in this release and need to notify Private Beta customers of the following changes to the API:
Removed the databases list from the List Database Instance Details call.
Removed the single database attribute from the Create User call.
Modified the List Users in Database Instance call to display the databases on which users have privileges.

listitem.para: Public Facing

para.link: Create instance, optionally add users when adding a database
Modify 'create user' - remove singular database attribute
Get user association shows DBs now
Adding used space to volume info

listitem.para: Mgmt Facing
OpenVZ quotas bug fixed.
Validating commands that should not allow you to delete/edit while they are in progress.
Mgmt IP association mistake causing mgmt api to crash/return all IPs in DB.
Logging around authorization failures.
202 messages return header only (no more weird text body).
http->https for images/instances.
Allow volume in error status to be deleted.
Added validation for running instances before operations can be submitted.
Removed DBs from GET instances/ID.
Miscellaneous cleanup around OVZ on instance deletion.
Failed instances no longer show up as null in mgmt api.
Miscellaneous doc fixes.
Fix bug around creating multiple users in a create instance.
Fix a race condition in instance provisioning.
